availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William R Minish (Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Owen County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Richard J. Minish and Louisa Minish. Clerk in Carroll County, Kentucky in 1860. Farmer in Owen County, Kentucky in 1864. Appointed postmaster in Gratz, Owen County on April 20, 1864. Served in the 54th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 12, 1864 to September 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owen County, District 1, p. 253A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, Carrollton, p. 6.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 365 (on microfilm) (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0462.
Find A Grave, "William Richard Minish Sr. (14 Sep 1840-20 May 1929)," Memorial #25368809, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25368809(accessed June 16, 2020).
